name: FPGA Mesh Renderer
desc: A 3D mesh renderer implemented in Verilog for an FPGA. The renderer is capable of rendering 3D models with textures and lighting. The project was developed as part of a course project for ECE243 at the University of Toronto.

name: OCAD "SunSet" GradEx Demo
desc: A demo of a sunset simulation using an Arduino and a ReactJS frontend. The project was developed as part of a course project for OCAD University's Digital Futures program.

name: Kimathi's Portfolio
desc: A personal website developed using ReactJS. The website is a showcase of Kimathi Bwomono's projects and skills.

name: ESPII Arduino Protoype
desc: A prototype of an ESP32-based IoT device developed for the course APS112 at the University of Toronto. The device is meant to be used as an alternative means of communication for non-verbal individuals with ASD.

name: DotRender & Slope Fields
desc: A simple 2D renderer developed in C# with the Unity Game Engine. The renderer is capable of rendering 2D Graphics based off of Dynamic Slope/Scalar Fields.

name: Infinite Sudoku
desc: A Sudoku game developed in Java with Java Swing. The game features an infinite number of puzzles generated using a backtracking algorithm.

name: The Starving Student
desc: A hackathon project developed at NewHacks 2022. The project is a web application that helps students find places to eat around the UofT campus.
